sentences: Tema on hea eesti keeles ja oskad hästi inglise keelt.
context: The Estonian word 'oskan' is the first person singular present form of the verb 'oskama', which means 'to be able to'. It specifically translates to 'I can' in English. This is a modal auxiliary verb used to indicate ability or capability. The word changes form based on the subject (I, you, he/she, we, they) and tense.
